greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of Carlitz compositions of n with exactly k descents; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=floor(n/3), read by rows.
comment: No two adjacent parts of a Carlitz composition are equal.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..250, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, expand(
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n, 0)):
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, 1, Expand[Sum[If[j == i, 0, b[n-j, j]*If[j<i, x, 1]], {j, 1, n}]]]; T[n_] := Function[{p}, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, 0]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 13 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 27 2014
